Hi all,

I have been trying to install cantera with Matlab in linux and hav=
e
come up against a problem I can't get around.

I'm using Ubuntu linux 5.1=
0, with gcc4.0.2, python 2.4, numarray and
matlab 7.1, and trying to compil=
e cantera 1.6.0r2.

As suggested in a previous post by Ricky, I moved the l=
ibrary files
from sys/os/glnx86.  This got rid of one problem, and everythi=
ng
seemed to install OK, but I have a different problem when trying to
run =
the demos from matlab.  I get the following when I try to run
cantera_demos=
.m

??? 

************************************************
                =
Cantera Error!                  
******************************************=
******


Procedure: ct2ctml
Error:   cannot open ./.cttmp1151036665.pyw for=
 writing.

Error in =3D=3D> XML_Node.XML_Node at 11
   x.id =3D ctmethods(1=
0,15,0,src); % newxml(name)

Error in =3D=3D> Solution.Solution at 30
doc =
=3D XML_Node('doc',src);

Error in =3D=3D> IdealGasMix at 39
       s =3D S=
olution(a);

Error in =3D=3D> equil at 12
   gas =3D IdealGasMix('gri30.cti=
');

Error in =3D=3D> run_examples at 3
equil(0);

Error in =3D=3D> cantera=
_demos at 3
run_examples;



Can anyone help me to get this toolbox running=
?

Thanks,

Sean
